commitMessage:
feat: replace PM scripts with TypeScript adapter pattern (HODGE-288)

## What Changed
- Replaced 8 JavaScript PM scripts (455 lines) with TypeScript PMHooks class
- Enhanced PMHooks with configuration loading from hodge.json
- Added silent failure pattern for external PM updates (never blocks workflow)
- Implemented operation serialization to prevent race conditions
- Fixed status format inconsistency (capitalized â†’ lowercase)
- Added 5 new integration tests for PM hooks functionality
- Removed deprecated getPMScriptExamples from init command
- Updated all workflow commands (explore, build, harden) to use new hooks

## Why This Change
The script-based PM integration was fragile and hard to maintain. Scripts
required external dependencies and failed loudly, blocking workflow. The new
adapter pattern provides better type safety, testability, and resilience.

## Impact
- PM updates now fail silently with optional debug logging
- Concurrent feature updates handled safely with serialization
- Configuration-driven status mappings via hodge.json
- Better test coverage (27 PM tests all passing)
- Reduced codebase by ~250 lines while adding functionality
- Prepared for future PM tool adapters (Linear, GitHub, Jira)

## Technical Details
- PMHooks loads config from .hodge/config.json (pm-hooks.ts:44)
- LocalPMAdapter handles file operations with queue (local-pm-adapter.ts:31)
- Silent failure prevents workflow interruption (pm-hooks.ts:141)
- Status format standardized to lowercase throughout

Closes HODGE-288
